titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thornton Moore, Indictment
CWG7574

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Ander Cty Circuit Court
Thornton Moore

The Grand Jury of Anderson County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Thornton Moore of the offense of "Malicious Wounding" Committted as follows the said Thornton Moore on the 1st day of April 1864 in the county aforesaid did wilfully and maliciously shoot at and wound Lewis Walker with a Gun or other instrument loaded with a leaden bullit or other hard substance with intent thereby the said Lewis Walker to kill against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witness before the Jury
Lewis Walker
John R Buckner
Bud Searcy
Allen S McKee
L. H. Noble Atty for Comth

A true Copy attest
C. H. Fenwick C. A. C. C
By, Wiley, Searcy, D. C

Anderson Ct Ct
vs
T Moore.
